bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Mr. and Mrs. Albert E. Truby

div1.p: Hench informs the Trubys that Emilie L. Reed died.

div1.head: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Mr. and Mrs. Albert E. Truby, July 23, 1950
div1.opener:
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT
1206
Send the following message, subject to the terms on back hereof, which are hereby agreed to
GENERAL AND MRS ALBERT E TRUBY 145 LAUREL ST
SAN FRANCISCO CALIF
div1.p:
MRS WALTER REED DIED THIS SUNDAY MORNING. FUNERAL TUESDAY
330 ARLINGTON. SONS ADDRESS 2810 36TH PLACE NW WASHINGTON
div1.closer:
DR PHILIP S HENCH COPY NL SENT JULY 23RD
C
